tap

Class TAPSyncJob.SyncThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • tap.TAPSyncJob.SyncThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Enclosing class:
    TAPSyncJob

    protected class TAPSyncJob.SyncThread
extends java.lang.Thread

    Thread which will process the job execution.

    Actually, it will basically just call ADQLExecutor.start(Thread, String, TAPParameters, HttpServletResponse) with the given ADQLExecutor and TAP parameters (containing the ADQL query to execute).

    Version:
    2.0 (04/2015)
    Author:
    Grégory Mantelet (CDS;ARI)

    • Field Detail

      • executor

        protected final ADQLExecutor executor
        Object knowing how to execute an ADQL query and which will execute it by calling ADQLExecutor.start(Thread, String, TAPParameters, HttpServletResponse).

      • response

        protected final javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response
        Response in which the query result must be written. No error should be written in it directly at this level ; the error must be propagated and it will be written in this HTTP response later on a top level.

      • ID

        protected final java.lang.String ID
        ID of this thread. It is also the ID of the synchronous job owning this thread.

      • tapParams

        protected final TAPParameters tapParams
        Parameters containing the ADQL query to execute and other execution parameters/options.

      • exception

        protected java.lang.Throwable exception
        Exception that occurs while executing this thread. NULL if the execution was a success.

      • report

        protected TAPExecutionReport report
        Query execution report. NULL if the execution has not yet started.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TAPSyncJob.SyncThread

        public TAPSyncJob.SyncThread(ADQLExecutor executor,
                     java.lang.String ID,
                     TAPParameters tapParams,
                     javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Create a thread that will run the given executor with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        executor - Object to execute and which knows how to execute an ADQL query.
        ID - ID of the synchronous job owning this thread.
        tapParams - TAP parameters to use to get the query to execute and the execution parameters.
        response - HTTP response in which the ADQL query result must be written.

    • Method Detail

      • isSuccess

        public final boolean isSuccess()
        Tell whether the execution has ended with success.
        Returns:
        true if the query has been successfully executed, false otherwise (or if this thread is still executed).

      • getError

        public final java.lang.Throwable getError()
        Get the error that has interrupted/stopped this thread. This function returns NULL if the query has been successfully executed.
        Returns:
        Error that occurs while executing the query or NULL if the execution was a success.

      • getExecutionReport

        public final TAPExecutionReport getExecutionReport()
        Get the report of the query execution.
        Returns:
        Query execution report.

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
